entry.title: Pashinyan: Armenia should hand over 4 border villages to avoid new war

media:group.media:title: Pashinyan: Armenia should hand over 4 border villages to avoid new war
media:group.media:description:
üìç Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan said handing over four abandoned villages in Armenia‚Äôs northeastern Tavush region to Azerbaijan may be the only way to avoid a new war. üìç Pashinyan again criticized a Russian-led military bloc for failing to meet its obligations to Armenia, even as the Kremlin indicated he may hold talks with Vladimir Putin soon. üìç Armenia is considering asking European Union observers to continue monitoring the border with Azerbaijan through the end of 2026, Pashinyan confirmed.
Credits: Ruptly

entry.title: Amid further shooting, Armenia calls on Baku to cease escalation

media:group.media:title: Amid further shooting, Armenia calls on Baku to cease escalation
media:group.media:description:
üìç The head of the Council of Europe expressed the organization‚Äôs support for Armenia‚Äôs reform process on a visit yesterday to Yerevan. üìç Days of shooting from Azerbaijan along the Armenian border continued last night as villages were hit in the vicinity of Goris. üìç No final decision has been made on whether Armenia-Azerbaijan border delimitation will start from the Tavush region. üìç Watch More: Interview with Baroness Caroline Cox- https://youtu.be/iCJRzkWB-xE

entry.title: Baroness Cox's Lifelong Mission for Nagorno-Karabakh

media:group.media:title: Baroness Cox's Lifelong Mission for Nagorno-Karabakh
media:group.media:description:
‚ÄúA voice for people whose voices are not heard.‚Äù That‚Äôs how Humanitarian activist and long-time advocate for Artsakh, Baroness Caroline Cox, talks about how she used her privileged position as a member of the UK House of Lords. In that capacity, she made over 90 trips to Nagorno-Karabakh in order to raise international awareness and support humanitarian initiatives. She discusses her steadfast commitment to promoting human rights, justice, and durable solutions for the region's people. ‚ÄúI hope I‚Äôll be able to go back with them,‚Äù she says.

entry.title: What can be done to safeguard the cultural heritage in Karabakh

media:group.media:title: What can be done to safeguard the cultural heritage in Karabakh
media:group.media:description:
Following the 2023 ethnic cleansing of Armenians from Artsakh, Baku has already began erasing any trace of Armenians in the region. Azerbaijani social media is already rife with videos depicting the destruction of Armenian heritage sites. In this report, CivilNet explores the background of the cultural heritage destruction in Artsakh and asks what steps can be taken to prevent complete erasure.
